document.topic_text: How Do You Compare to the Competition? Get facts about other applicants with a CareerBuilder Account Sign Up Job Description BAE Systems is seeking a geospatial professional to support two government customers. As a member of the Scanning Prep Team, candidates will focus on collecting, organizing, ingesting metadata, and processing digital images. Candidate will ensure maps, digital geospatial, topographic, and cartographic resources are available for future open source use. Adding metadata from geospatial products into databases (using Microsoft Access, and various Integrated Library System (ILS) programs) • Enhance digital images by using Adobe Photoshop. • Support Library of Congress map/chart archiving activity. • Scanning geospatial products using flat-bed and feeder scanning equipment • Editing and processing images for clarity and accuracy • Performing large-scale data quality work • Checking validity of metadata • Editing metadata to ensure accuracy using multiple ILS programs Minimum Education and Experience Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience: Bachelors and two years experience or six years of experience, if no degree • Experience with Microsoft Office Word, Excel, and Access. • Good organizational skills. • Demonstrate initiative, flexibility, ability to work creatively and effectively both independently and as a team. Preferred Skills and Education Experience with geospatial software or data is a plus. Document management experience desired but not required. About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do-from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. That's BAE Systems. That's Inspired Work. Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Gender Expression. To see Inspired Work in action, visit www.baesystems.com and follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/baesystemsintel. EEO Career Site Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities . females . veterans . individuals with disabilities . sexual orientation . gender identity . gender expression Department
